availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Fidler (Marion County, Kentucky, schoolteacher, Captain and Provost Marshall)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, schoolteacher, Captain and Provost Parshall. Son of Samuel Fidler and Mary Fidler. Schoolteacher in Marion County in 1860. Served as First Lieutenant in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from November 21, 1861 to July 9, 1862. Served as Captain and Provost Marshall of the 4th Congressional District in Lebanon, Kentucky in December 1864.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 816.
